revised_title: Isolation and Growth of the Lepra Bacillus Using Tubercle Bacillus Medium
tldr: The authors successfully isolate and grow the lepra bacillus using a medium containing ground-up tubercle bacilli. The lepra bacillus grows slowly but eventually forms well-formed, acid-fast rods. This method may lead to the development of a vaccine for leprosy and further research on related acid-fast bacteria.
